alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 09 at 7:12PM CDT until April 09 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LUBBOCK COUNTY... At 711 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lubbock South Plains Mall, or over Lubbock, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 605 PM CDT, quarter size hail was observed in several locations across Lubbock. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Wolfforth, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock and Lubbock Science Spectrum. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In addition to large hail, significant amounts of smaller hail are likely. Accumulating hail can cause damage to crops, trees, and vehicles.
